place.name: ASTON SUBEDGE
place.gazetteerText: ASTON-SUB-EDGE, a parish in the district of Evesham and county of Gloucester; on the West Midland railway, under Bredon hill, 2 miles SSW of Honeybourne r. station, and 6 ESE of Evesham. Post Town, Campden, under Moreton-in-the-Marsh. Acres, 755. Real property, £1,503. Pop., 128. Houses, 27. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Gloucester and Bristol. Value, £204.* Patron, Earl Harrowby. The church is tolerable. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
